p: Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV) is a zoonotic arbovirus that infects humans, livestock and wildlife species. The disease it causes, Rift Valley fever (RVF), is a World Health Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) listed disease and is a World Health Organisation (WHO) priority disease for research and development due to its potential to cause major epidemics in humans [ 1]. RVF was discovered in 1931 on a farm in the Great Rift Valley of Kenya [ 2] and, to date, it has only been reported in African countries and the Arabian Peninsula [ 3].
